Reviews.Title: “Dreary and Dated. Great location though.”
Reviews.Author: JamesPharm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights over the Easter long weekend. The hotel is not much to boast about. Every day my room keys stopped working so I had to go get new ones - the room was farthest from the elevator so this was frustrating. The decor of the hotel was extremely dated and a bit of a Chinese stereotype to the max. The hotel is dark and dreary - the rooms could use some updates. The room was clean enough and the bed was comfy enough for me to get a decent sleep. I would stay here again if the price were right. I got the room off Hot Wire for $76 a night. The place is right in China Town and close to the subway as well as old town montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for business, was okay”
Reviews.Author: mototours
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was a mix Some staff great Some staff not so good Room was clean and bed comfy. I am priority club member but it didn't seem to count for much. I forgot my card and they didn't even offer to assist me looking up the number, nor did they offer any upgrade or welcome package that some Holiday Inns offer. When I checked out the staff member suggested that if I was a gold member it would have been different.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Naomi B
Reviews.Content: I got a 4 nights stay for $ 63/night through hotwire. Location is perfect, right accross the street from the subway & not too far from downtown either. Spacious room & bathroom, very clean & comfortable beds. We arrived 3 hours earlier & they allowed us to check-in early without an additional charge. Front desk very helpful however, the restaurant only offers breakfast buffet & chinese food is the only thing on the menu for lunch or dinner. When asked for the room to be cleaned, only the sheets & towels were changed. I understand that the hotel is located in china town but that's no reason why the spa, salon, travel agency ... should all be chinese & the stores in the hotel only sell chinese stuff from clothing to souvenirs. I visited Montreal, not China. Also hotel rooms have no fridge

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, clean, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Allyally19
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and both times I was very impressed. Staff was friendly and efficient. Check in and out was fast and painless. The second time we stayed here our room was double booked and after offering us a number of things they promptly apologized and switched us to the king suite. We were pleased with this. The concierge was extremely helpful and pleasant to talk to and reccomended a number of restaurants and malls and even gave us directions to the market at Jean Talon. There is a pool and gym which was a little outdated but served the purpose and was clean. They also have a restaurant which looked good but we never went. This hotel is in a good location in Chinatown beside Old Montreal and close to St Laurent and St Catherine. The subway is steps away and if you feel like walking to or from the Greyhound bus station with all your luggage it's about a 15 minute walk. Overall this is a nice hotel and I would definately stay here again and reccomended it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: corinewton
Reviews.Content: Although the location was superb...in between old montreal and downtown and right across the street from the Metro. Front staff was friendly and helpful but the lineup was quite long when I had to only validate my parking ticket. The room was very small and the carpet was filthy. Not sure how hard it would be to get a carpet cleaner in there. Gross. The room was overpriced for the quality. Parking fee of $22 per day was a little much. I likely won't stay there again unless there is a good sale.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SJD-21704
Reviews.Content: First the disclaimer - we made our reservation through Hotwire. Since we did not know the hotel until after purchasing the reservation, using our method may put you into a different property. But, the nightly room rate was very budget friendly. We were very pleased with this hotel. Our stay was for three nights. The location was perfect; across from a subway stop and a very easy walking distance to great shopping, restaurants, sightseeing locations, parks, and the train station. The rooms were clean, large and nicely furnished. There was a soda vending machine and an ice machine on our floor. The front desk staff members were professional, helpful, and friendly. Our only problem was with a burnt-out light bulb. To bring it to the attention of the housekeeper, we removed it from the lamp and placed it on the nightstand; the housekeeper removed the bulb but did not leave us a new bulb. A stop at the front desk resulted in a new bulb being installed while we were out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, if you get it for a good price, better yet!”
Reviews.Author: AdirondackGypsy
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews on this hotel and they run the gamut from real bad to real good. My opinion from our recent stay would have this property somewhere in the middle. The location is hard to beat. Close to both Chinatown, Old Montreal, St. Catherine St. and right across the street from The Palais des congres Montreal. The service leaves alot to be desired at this place and it really needs a complete make over. The room seemed pretty clean and in good repair. The view was nice from our room. The pool was nice and we had to trouble with the elevated hot tub. We did not eat at the hotel and when I tried to buy a non alcoholic beer, there was none and then the same bartender would not make me a cup of coffee either...so much for customer service! The lobby area is a very relaxing atmosphere with all of the water , fountains and goldfish. We got the room for $68 a night from a Hotwire blind bid. Would we stay again? Certainly!

Reviews.Title: “Let down”
Reviews.Author: Jagjam
Reviews.Content: A brand you can rely on? Let down by the lack of an in house bar/snack facility. The In house restaurant served Chinese food only and was extremely open and cold in temperature and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential, but continues to suffer”
Reviews.Author: gngottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on an Entertainment Card discount in an executive room. We come here once a year and this year was a major improvement in some areas and a disappointment in others: Pros: heated pool and functioning hottub (this was not the case in previous stays); spacious (executive) room that was ready for us 2.5 hours before check-in; free wi-fi. Cons: the quality of Chez Chine has really declined; the dim sum was once well worth its high price but is now a Chinatown average; the breakfast buffet choices are fewer and blander--no more omelet station, lukewarm congee; we were also charged for cots--I'm not sure if that's industry standard but other chains never charged me. We only stay here for its location and outstanding kid-friendly lobby, but feel forced to look now at other options. Even their liquor licence was pulled. I have made constructive criticisms in the past, as have others. Why doesn't HIS heed these reviews and improve?

Reviews.Title: “Good deal if less than $75”
Reviews.Author: TAr0cks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in late December. Booked the room through hotwire and paid $76 USD /night with tax & service. Pros: - Location is great, super close to Old Montreal & Metro - Stay is only a good deal if you can get a rate of $75 or less. If I paid anymore than that, I would not think the stay was worth the money - They didn't have any non-smoking King rooms at the time of check-in, but gave us a non-smoking Queen room (#533), the room was extra spacious because it is a corner room. - We didn't have any problems with room carpet as stated by another reviewer. Everything in the room was clean and basic. Cons: - Hotel is definitely not a 3.5 stars as stated by Hotwire. Hotel is 3-stars. - Hotel is on top of Chinese plaza, when we got out of the elevator on the 5th floor, it smelled like Chinese food, and then it smelled like horrible garbage as soon as you turn. Hotel should really do something, at least put in some air freshener in the hallway (no smell in room). - Flat screen TV is nice, but they disabled movie playing capabilities from external devices, so we couldn't plug in a usb key to play a movie. Ended up watching via laptop. - Parking is $23/day, which is kind of high. But in comparison to nearby parking lots, the rate is fair (ie. $15/for 12 hours, $22/day, etc). - We had trouble finding the entrance to the parking garage on the first day!! Front desk did not pick up when we called, ended up having to go up to reception to ask. The entrance is on St. Urbain, which is a one-way street. - Washroom was really dark and fan extremely loud. Can use some additional lighting. - Heat/AC unit under window is kind of loud - Menu is pretty basic (mostly chinese food except for breakfast), we didn't eat at the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay For a Hotwire Deal”
Reviews.Author: action_jackson2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Holiday Inn was a decent one. The staff was friendly and our room was okay. However (and this is a big however), the carpet in our room was absolutely mortifying! There were a number of stains - some which looked as old as the hotel itself. We were afraid to take out shoes of at all times. Long story short: it was a good deal but be prepared to toss your socks upon checking out.

Reviews.Title: “I am an employee and I was not that happy with the service”
Reviews.Author: JerrySYL
Reviews.Content: Basically I joined a Chinese tour group and stayed here. Although I have employee discount because I also work for IHG but because I am in a tour I don't get the discount but it is totally fine. The hotel looks very old, the rooms, the lobby, the exterior, everything looks outdated and I felt like I went back to the 80s. The room was very old looking and outdated, it had a "old" smell, we didn't want to touch anything without sanitizing them. The lobby was dark and they should have more lights to give people a welcoming feeling, and at least just so people can find their way. My experience was this: I was hoping to give my tour guide a call because I left something on the tour coach bus. I saw a house phone in the lobby so I picked it up, and there was no answer. So I went to the front desk and waited (we were the only two people in the whole lobby). I saw a couple of people in the back office but I was polite enough to wait. Then, 2 staffs and 1 night manager came out from the back office, only 1 greeted me but not the others because they were chatting. The only one who greeted me (I meant he just said Hello with no smile) asked me to pick up the house phone beside the front desk instead of the first one I had, which was fine to me. I picked up the house phone, then this guy was working on something, then turned around and joined the conversation of the other two men, then transferred my call, but that was after like 5 rings! Thumbs up to this kind of service. I do want to comment on two positives though: We liked the complimentary shampoo/conditioner/lotion because they were Bath & Body Works, but as an IHG employee I think that is not what it's suppose to be according to standard. The location was absolutely great because it is so close to the Old Montreal and Notre-Dame Basilica. Although the hotel is in Chinese town, we do not recommend you to any of those Chinese restaurant because they taste like Mandarin buffet, which is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: nekobaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location - just outside of Chinatown, across the street from the Metro and a short walk to shopping on St. Catherine, the Latin Quarter and Old Montreal. My biggest complaint is that many consider this to be a 3 1/2 star hotel - maybe it is 2 1/2 stars. The rooms were big, but there was a musty smell to the hotel and the air quality in the room was REALLY dry. If I had paid full price, I would never recommend this hotel. But I got the room through one of those blind Hotwire deals and for the price I paid, this was perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: CanEnglishTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been to several Holida Inn locations, includin Holiday Inn express, and this is by far the worst. The floor I staued on had a thick odour of urine just outside the elevator doors, which was more than enough to put me off. The building is incredibly run down, and the car park is horrifyingly neglected. Do not stay at this location if you value an enjoying stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back again”
Reviews.Author: stayclassy10
Reviews.Content: We were here on anniversary. We mainly chose the hotel based on location as we wanted to be close to Old Montreal where we spent most of our time. Our rate included breakfast and it was delicious! Nothing fancy but satisfying. The breakfast area was interesting looking. The staff at breakfast were also very helpful. The room was spacious and clean, on the executive floor with a nice flat screen tv and decent view. The bed was very comfortable! The check in process was very quiet and awkward. The agent was nice but it would be better to offer more information about the hotel amenities upon check in. When we had a question, we called, the front desk agent gave us the answer then when we thanked her, she just hung up... not even a "my pleasure" or "you're welcome" or "bye". I thought it was odd how the Front Desk was on the second floor, but I'd also like to add that it was a good thing to have the key card access at the front door for security. However, we never saw anyone at Concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FnkyGreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference for 3 nights, and brought my husband and 2 young children along. The price was good for the location - right across the street from the subway, steps from Old Montreal, shopping, and restaurants. Our room could be updated and the room was facing the fire station so there were sirens occasionally (but it's a big, busy city so what can you do?) We were comfortable. The kids were able to enjoy the pool area - the pool was cold, however. The concierge was especially helpful and extremely friendly. The cost of the buffet breakfast was not a super value ($20) but the food was ok. There was an additional cost for parking ($23/day). Overall, it was a good - nothing extraordinary but a decent choice as a base to explore the city or for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaBetty
Reviews.Content: As noted in other reviews, the hotel is in a great location, very close to Chinatown and 3 blocks to Old Montreal. In addition, the Metro is across the street and the 747 Express bus to the airport is 1.5 blocks away. A ticket can be purchased for the 747 at the Metro station The staff at all levels are courteous and responsive to any problems or enquiries. All mattresses have been replaced within the last year so they are new and comfortable. We had 2 out of three nights of interrupted sleep due to our next door neighbours, not the fault of the hotel , and security dealt with the problem as soon as it was reported. It did however interfere with our energy level on two days of a three day stay. The security is somewhat lax in that anyone can take the elevator to the floors which could be problematic in a large city. Like a recent reviewer, we questionned the lack of a liquor license in a large convention hotel with a reputation for a great restaurant. Overall, it would not be a first choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an upgrade, needs alcohol!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelguru2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn in hina Town for a work trip and I must say I was disappointed. The hotel has not been updated since what appears to be the mid-nineties. Whilst the initial reception area is [pleasant enough - with a tadition coy carp pond with small bridges over it. The bar in the reception is unmanned as they have lost their liquor licence (or as the note on the table says there is a delay in receiving it.. which leaves me suspicious), however they aren't even serving soft drinks or coffees from the bar. The room was a decent size, although the bed was very soft and the walls incredibly thin - an issue if the next door occupant has an alarm before yours. I wouldn't go back - there are nicer hotels ni Montreal for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, great location, not luxurious for the price.”
Reviews.Author: vlichadan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, literally wedged between adjacent Chinatown and Old Town Montreal. You can walk about 3 blocks to Notre Dame Cathedral, which is the beginning of the Old Town area. One block away is all the Chinese restaurants of Chinatown. The subway station is literally across the street. Lovely service from room service meals to conceirge help with finding your way around Montreal, including explaining the subway system to you, which takes you everywhere you want to go and can avoid those expensive taxis. Hotel isn't luxurious but standard business class level, with some updating of rooms probably due. But it isn't unpleasant in anyway. The buffet breakfast is sadly not included, you have to pay $20 Canadian extra for it. I think at these prices they should include it. Convenient small stores at ground level for picking up snacks or last minute souvenirs, plus a convenient drug store right across the street. Very nice bilingual staff, rooms clean, good value I thought. Nice temperature control and comfortable beds. If the hotel wanted to improve their services, they should provide a shuttle to the airport for free and the breakfast buffet included with the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: For very convoluted reasons, I had to transfer hotels at the end of my trip, and I thought I'd booked into the Holiday Inn which is adjacent to the HGI I was staying in - but I managed to screw up my online booking and book the "Select Centre Ville" which is much close to the old town of Montreal. This was not a big deal, and it was interesting to sample a different hotel. The hotel looks a bit strange - the building has a Chinese look to it, which is because it is close to Chinatown. Check in was puzzling - once I found reception it was efficient and quick, but you enter on the ground level and then have to take a lift up a couple of levels where you exit into the main lobby area. I was upgraded by the main benefit of the upgrade was that the room was massive - so big that the bed looked lost in the middle of it. The room was also as far as is it is possible to be from the lifts, but that was not a big deal. The room was clean, but had seen better days, and the bathroom was a bit modular, but again clean. My sleep was comfortable, and for the price paid, it was fine. I did not eat, either in the evening or the following morning, because of committments, so cannot rate the restaurant. But the hotel is very convenient for old Montreal with all its eateries and boutiques. OK for one night, but not sure I would recommend for longer.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ohnojackdied
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for the second time, and wouldn't hesitiate to stay here again if we return to Montreal. The location is excellent--right on the edge of Old Montreal, as well as right on the edge of Chinatown, as well as being right across from the Metro. So there's easy access to everything (for us as tourists). The hotel itself is very nice and well priced for a hotel in a downtown major city. We liked the Chinese theme--very elegant and a nice contrast to the Old city. We stayed on the executive floor, as priority members and it was clean, and with a huge bathroom. The restaurant is a pleasant setting with a huge fish pond (huge!) and Chinese decor. We only had breakfast there on this visit, but had dinner there on a previous visit and it was very good. The only downside is the $23 a night charge for parking--yikes! We found we didn't need the car though while there. Overall, we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough!”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne K
Reviews.Content: Location is awesome, room was great, bathroom was clean, rates were decent, staff were polite enough, lobby/reception was cool (with the restaurant and the fish, haha), shampoo/conditioner/lotion were excellent... Parking is an additional $20/night, the curtains weren't very clean, could hear people out in the hallway. Not a bad choice though, overall!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: DUpton
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this hotel and am glad I'm only here for one night. The hotel was nice enough to upgrade my room due to my status with their rewards program. The hotel is old and my room shows it. The carpet is not very clean and is damp, but the furnishings are nice and modern. The hotel is in a nice location for a downtown hotel and there are restaurants within walking distance. This is really nice as parking could be an issue due to limited spaces. Parking is also expensive at $23 per day.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: 186400Caroline
Reviews.Content: Across the road from the metro and in a great place to walk to the sights and to some fantastic restaurants

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Brooke F
Reviews.Content: One good thing about this hotel? The location is good. One bad thing about this hotel? EVERYTHING ELSE Horrible customer service, rude employees, jerks who work there . . . . get the picture? While checking in (after waiting in line for 10 minutes because only one employee was working the front desk), I was told I did not have a reservation. I was asked to go to the 9th floor and print out a reservation from my email account. Then, because the person working the front desk was ignoring me, I had to wait in line another 15 minutes. Then, if you ask them a question, they just stare at you and frown. The elevators smell like vomit. The hot tub is even more disgusting. Go somewhere else. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sasktraveller97
Reviews.Content: It is located on the edge of Chinatown, across the street from the Place d'armes metro stn (with a Time Hortons and a convenience store) and two blocks up from Notre Dame. The facility is beautifully done with asian and western decor. There is a guest laundry available. There is a fire station nearby but the noise is minimal. Though the area is not entirely touristy and the park across the street seems to provide a home to several, we were comfortable walking to and from the Old Port area in the day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town”
Reviews.Author: boyblue4502
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel after a four night stay and I want to say it was great. The only negative I would honestly give it is that the furniture in the rooms needed to be updated. Otherwise, the room itself is clean and it is comfortable. There is a pool but I didn't use it. Also, on our floor, there is access to a washing machine and a dryer. The main reason to stay honestly is I think is the location. It is pretty much within about 15 minutes or less walking distance to all the main areas. It is across the street from the Place d' Armes subway station as well as a block away from bus # 747, which takes you directly to the airport. No need for a cab. Behind the hotel are wonderful chinese restaurants with some open until 3am for anyone that is in need of late night eats. There are also pastry shops on that same street as well. I believe parking is about 23 dollars a day, so parking can be a pricey proposition for anyone here. Hope this helps and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ljsmith35
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at this hotel... good old Montreal location. Right next to the subway. Hotel was clean and pretty much exactly what I expected. Had a really good weekend rate through Travel Zoo. Montreal is always fantastic in the summer, rates are normally much higher - sure this made the experience more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Albert394
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a trip that included 3 nights in the Holiday Inn Select Montreal Centre Ville Hotel. Top Things about Hotel Location - In the heart of China Town, a just a short walk from Old Montreal Cleanliness - room was clean. Room Size - Had a double with two queen beds. Room was of ample size with a nice size bathroom Pool - Pool was clean and was a decent size. Lobby - Enjoyed the large reflecting pools with the Poy fish. Plenty of room to sit and lounge. Elevators - very little wait for elevators Staff - nice staff Dislikes NO FREE PARKING!!!! Get ready to pay 23 dollars a night for on premises parking!!! No discount for being a guest of the hotel! The expensive parking certainly reduces the grade I give the hotel for value. Room, Furniture, lamps needed upgrading No flat screen television

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the convention Center, old Montreal and China town”
Reviews.Author: irishpk53
Reviews.Content: I came to Montreal for a convention. I had looked up a hotel close to the convention center and this one popped up. I am very comfortable staying at Holiday Inns, Holiday Express, etc. Always one of my first choices. The housekeeping staff was great. Always had our room spotlessly clean and in record time. The wait staff in the dining room are just as great. After the first couple of days, they recognized me and always had my eggs cooking and hot tea for my friend. The concieres (all 3 of them) were always so helpful in answering our questions about routes and buses to get around the city. The only problem I had was I had booked a room with 2 queen beds 17 weeks in advance with Travelocity. When I arrived I was told they only had a room with a king size bed. I was traveling with another lady. I found that really unacceptable with the advanced reservation and a credit card guarantee. The hotel offered a rollaway bed to be put in the room, but that was not the point. I even called Monday prior to arriving on Friday to confirm my 2 queed bed room and was told, yes they had my reservation. So I was alittle more than put out when I arrived on Friday evening at 10:00 p.m. with luggage for a week's stay and in a city I had never been to before to be told I didn't have the room I reserved. But I do want to say the staff from housekeeping to dining to the concieres were fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Not great but we saw no bedbugs so I'm happy”
Reviews.Author: johnston6777
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fair to poor. There were no heavy curtains, it stunk, was dark as well as dank, and the restaurant had a strict policy which prohibited ordering carry out. However, the main lobby was appealing, the location was great, and the bathroom was spacious. I enjoyed the hard mattress but that is not everyoneâ€™s preference. Their American breakfast was delicious with a wide range of fruits as well as bacon and sausage. I did not encounter bedbugs at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: HotplateOntario
Reviews.Content: - took Via rail from TO , and this hotel is within walking distance from the station- about a 15 min walk, or a taxis would be about $8 -booked thru priceline for $80 per night , ended up about $100 per night after taxes and fees. -if we were driving the parking fees are $23 extra per night at this hotel - when we got to the hotel we received a upgraded room on the 8'th floor with a king bed for no extra charge. The location is very good for walking for both old Montreal, St Catherine street shopping, street festivals . - you could easily be entertained for a week just seeing places within walking distance from this hotal - we went during the Just for laughs Comedy festival so there was lots of free street shows during the day, and indoor ones you would pay for in the evenings -lots of restaurants right beside the hotel , mostly chinese restaurants but good food and cheap prices, I think they are competing with each other for business - I recommend the Noodle Factory restaurant across the street and the Chinese Buffet just around the corner. Norte-Dame Basilica ( where Celine Dion got married ) is literally a 5 minute walk away. -We also used the subway system (very easy to understand) to go places futher away. we toured the Bio Dome and St Joseph's Oratory - both worth it to see. -BioDome is a huge zoo and aquariam that features four ecosystems. -St Joseph's Oratory is a church where miracles are said to have happened. We seen lots of people climbing the hundreds of stairs leading up to the Oratory by knealing and saying a prayer on each step.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lovestoresearch
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three other girls for 2 nights over a weekend. I booked the room online and at the time of booking, I requested a quiet room on a higher floor that is far from the ice room and elevators and I was very pleased to to have gotten exactly what I asked for. The room itself was basic but clean and had all the amenities that we required. The only disappointment was that I had paid extra for a room with a "sitting area" thinking that the sitting area would have a couch like many of the other hotels that I've stayed at. There was a sitting area but it only had the television, a desk and chair. But with four girls sharing a room, it was worth it to have the extra space. The service at this hotel was very good. When we got to our room, we discovered that there were only three sets of towels. Since we had booked the room for 4 people, we called down to the the front desk, explaining the situation and asked for extra towels. The person at the front desk was very nice and towels were brought up within about 10 mins. We also left a tip for housekeeping with a small thank you note and we were very surprised to receive a thank you note in return! We thought it was very sweet that our tip was acknowledged, and housekeeping did a great job. This hotel is also very conveniently located in downtown Montreal. It is within walking distance of St. Catherine for shopping and also with walking distance of Old Port, which is a lovely place for dinner or an after dinner stroll. I would recommend this hotel for people who are just looking for a clean but basic room that is conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Co2_Ver-3
Reviews.Content: Right across from the metro, in Chinatown, Groceries up the block. All the staff are friendly and helpful. One even spent 20 minutes looking up info for us. Felt safe in the neighbourhood, even at 3am. The downside is no fridge unless you rent one ($25) and no microwave. When checking out I talked with an employee; said they will be renovating soon. Putting in new everything. We will go back after reno for sure though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rude Chinese waiters and bad hotel policy”
Reviews.Author: DANZAP
Reviews.Content: Its just opposite to the 'Palace de Congres Montreal' and very near to the Basilique Notre-Dame, China town and the old town. The room is spacious with a clean wash room. The house keeping is just excellent. The free continental breakfast is nothing great. The ambiance of the breakfast area is good but the Chinese waiters are very impolite and often rude. The hotel held approx. 300 Euro from my credit card against damage of property. They held this money for a week after my checkout. I could figure this out only after a couple of embarrassing 'Credit card declined' incidents. The front desk just said its their policy (which I was never informed during check-in). This is outrageous. If you have any business at the congress centre, go for this one, else go for other 'non Chinese' hotels like Holiday Inn Express just a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “In Dire Need of Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Belle-Lettrist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in the heart of Chinatown, and the lobby is nice enough. But the rooms are rundown. The beds are uncomfortable, the pillows are lumpy and half the size of standard pillows, the toilets don't flush properly, and the shower taps in my room looked like they were coming off the wall. The rates are expensive considering the low quality of the rooms. They may have planned the hotel around feng shui principles but it just isn't enough. I would prefer comfortable pillows and properly flushing toilets rather than harmony between the elements. Ranks in my top 10 worst hotels. Also overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value for the bag”
Reviews.Author: Spencertraveller
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here. Great staff and reception. Clean indeed, comfy bed. Nice location centrally located. Need to fix the slamming door though. Are all the rooms so dark ? and the bathrooms are all acceesible for the disabled ? Everytime I stay there i keep getting one. Strange layout though to access hotel. Elevator needs some freshing up and the overall renovations are needed but its still OK as the staff service and professional service make sup for it.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: poupoun
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel to stay at for price and location.. Staff is amazing especially Pierre and Jamil the concierge staff and Myriam at the front desk. We have been her 20x. Live outside Montreal and go for a quick get away..Buy an Entertainment Book and get and even better deal..Also join Priority Club with Holiday Inn as you get perks at different hotels.. Here it is newspapers. access to Internet and their lounge...Other holidays have othere perks.. Also late check out... Send a PM if you have any questions..

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the Conference Centre”
Reviews.Author: advcardio
Reviews.Content: The number 1 reason we stayed at this hotel was it's location to the Convention Centre -which was just across the street (when it's pouring rain or snow this would be a bonus). If you are looking for a "snazzy" high-end hotel to stay this would NOT be for you- the rooms are indeed "outdated" however the beds were very comfortable and every night we had a restful sleep. The rooms were clean , the bath towels were big and thick, the front desk always friendly and could quickly switch from French to English without being rude. In the front lobby they have a very large water pond with fish swimming around and found this to be a great oasis during breakfast buffet and after the conference in the lounge area. Breakfast buffet was decent and enjoyed all the FRESH fruit which changed everyday including strawberries and raspberries. *Tip when booking your room try the bed and breakfast option as this would prove to be much cheaper than not.. I would recommend this hotel if you are in town for a conference but not for your honeymoon. One more thing please- the hotel location is also very close to old montreal- no taxi is needed but do wear good shoes for the uneven cobble stoned streets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good service, very clean ... but quite outdated”
Reviews.Author: Djaidje_31600
Reviews.Content: Ideally located at equal distance from Old Town and Sainte Catherine (about 10 minutes walking). Wonderful lobby with its chinese decor. Staff is friendly and efficient. Restaurant is just average, even though breakfast is good enough for about 20 CAD. But; rooms are very old fashioned and would need refurbishing, even at executive level.

Reviews.Title: “Little Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: GuiltyPleasures08
Reviews.Content: I was here for a friends wedding in Septembre, Always wondered what this place would look like from the outside seeing as i saw it from the outside for over 20 years and never entered. It was surprisingly refreshing on the inside and i was very warmly greeted by Chrissy at the front desk. Nice decor, layout and the place can definitly accomodate large groups. Rooms had nice beds;however, they need some new life, the leak in the bathroom ceiling required all our towels on the floor and the ac units are old(but functional). Service...well where to start, the staff forgot to set up the sweets table and alcohol bar in the lobby. Seeing as there was another wedding they ran out of plates and were clearing each service on trays. Yes...they actually just laid mountains of leftover garbage food on a tray and walked out with it as if they were serving it... The banquet hall was boiling during the reception and they did not allow us to open any windows whatsoever. Even within the lobby we could not open the terrace doors whether it was day or night and it only made the ventilation worse. To add injury to insult, when we asked the waiter for water, they told us we had to buy it across the street because it was not included. Keep in mind this is a 200 person wedding...the negative wow factor was through the roof with that comment. Maybe we caught the hotel on a off night as i would still recommend people who arent money conscious to stay here because we did still have a great night, slept well and the food was delicious, i wouldnt however organise an event here myself.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: BethannO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was attending a conference being held there. Overall, it was just OK. The rooms were very clean and the bed was comfy. Yet the rooms are rather overdue for updating (broken closet door, sporadic TV issues, peeling wallpaper). The Chinese restaurant is pretty good, but is closed Sunday and Monday. I opted to eat at the bar the night of my arrival, and the service was rather slow. Also, the "business center" computer is outrageously slow and costs $10/hr.

Reviews.Title: “A good week”
Reviews.Author: jcm-chiseldon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for a week and it was fine. Well located, good sized room, quite.

Reviews.Title: “Safety Complaint”
Reviews.Author: StarwoodBoo
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible experience during my stay because I slipped in the bathtub after I stepped on the shower curtain. I hurt my back with some pain as the result of the slip. I am okay now but I am worrying about other people may get hurt because of the inferior quality of the shower curtain your hotel is using. The shower curtain is (1) too long and touching the base of the bathtub, (2) the internal sheet of the curtain is attached by easily separable buttons, (3) too light in weight - I slipped on the curtain and fall outside of the bathtub by tearing down the whole curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfan028
Reviews.Content: This hotel is newly renovated, and within walking distance of the old city. The metro is within a minute or two walk. There is a priority club lounge, but it is just a room with a couple of couches, oranges and a computer. The one minus was the service. It took nearly a day for a light bulb to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Started out poorly but ended on a good note”
Reviews.Author: geardots
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline which rated the hotel a 3starUpscale. Not really an accurate rating. We were booked into a smoking room (823) and although the room didn't smell that badly, the smell in the hallways actually prevented a good night sleep for me, but I am allergic and extremely sensitive to the smell. The gentleman who checked us in our first evening was not very accomodating when we asked if we could please have a non smoking room. He was rather abrupt and simply said they were completely booked the entire weekend and could not switch the room. Early the next morning I approached the young woman at the front desk as though I had walked in off the street and asked if a room was available. She quickly said yes and then I said that I wanted to switch from our current room to a non smoking one. It didn't happen immediately, but eventually she was able to fill my request. At first she wanted to charge me (more than 2x the rate I had paid through Priceline) and I said I didn't want to pay more, I just simply wanted a non smoking room. Our first room on the 8th floor only had 1 double bed and was very dismal with ceiling stains and tired decor (the "priceline room" I imagine) and I got the distinct impression that they did not want to give us a better room. The room we did then get assigned to was on the 3rd floor and was already cleaned and ready to occupy at 8 in the morning, leading me to believe that it had been empty all night. I am annoyed that the first front desk staff person was so unhelpful that first night. It's not as though an "upgrade" to meet our request was costing him personally and since the room was obviously empty, why would the hotel be so stingy about making us happy customers. I have had the pleasure of staying at a Marriott in Toronto through Priceline and we were upgraded to probably the best room in the hotel when we had not even requested a change. They simply knew good customer service and I will now sing the praises of the Marriott on Bloor in Yorkville in Toronto for taking the extra step to ensuring a great stay. Obviously the Holiday Inn does not follow this practice and so I was disappointed. In the end however, Josephine at the front desk, did accommodate us and I was very grateful and the room we had on the 3rd floor was bright, very clean, spacious (2 queen size beds) and non-smoking. Pierre is a wonderful conceriege who obviously loves helping people discover Montreal. It was pretty noisy each night we stayed but I bring ear plugs and can drown out some of the noise. Why people come in at 3 or 4am and find it necessary to laugh loudly and slam doors, I don't know. I assume they have been drinking and don't have a clue about respect. For the money we paid, we were pleased but in the end I think I will book 4star and above hotels and pay the extra. The location is really ideal however but there are many good locations so I wouldn't choose it based just on that. It's an okay place that needs some updating and repairs but if you are on a budget, it can work.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: iztehtravelbug
Reviews.Content: I went to Montreal for the very first time for the purposes of spending as much time (of my 3-day trip) as possible in Vieux-MontrÃ©al. After looking for days, I decided to take my chances with Holiday Inn Select. We got to Montreal and arrived at Gare Centrale. Turned out it was only two Metro stations away from this hotel. Figured out the Metro, got on a train, got off at Place D'Armes, and WOW this hotel was across the street! Convenient!!! We checked in - desk service was pretty good - went upstairs to settle in our rooms, removed the curtains, et voilÃ : We could see Notre-Dame Basilica from our window... Plais des congres is across the street (the Place D'Armes Station is inside the Plais des congres building)... we could see Old Montreal buildings! Anyway, my experience with this hotel was pretty great! I appreciate the immaculately clean rooms. Loved the beds - that was the best sleep I had had in months! I loved the fact that China Town extends just behind Holiday Inn Select. The walk around Old Montreal was superb - it was good knowing that we are not too far from where we're staying. On the negative side, the only problem I found was the sketchy wi-fi connection. I had a hard time staying connected... but heck, who wants to be on the internet when you're in Old Montreal! Thanks, Holiday Inn Select - I had a great time, and would definitely return on my next trip to Montreal! =)

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Trvlng_w_kids
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn over the long weekend. There were two families with kids in two connecting rooms. The connecting rooms were great for us...I phoned in advance to get them to note that I wanted side by side rooms on the reservation. Rooms were clean, and roomy. I would definitely stay here again especially for what I paid. I paid less than $100/nt plus tax plus parking..booked thru EasyClickTravel. Wished it had breakfast included but I knew when I booked that it didn't. Wish it had a fridge but again the Holiday Inn site doesn't indicate it had one so I didn't expect it. Wish it had a safe in the room but again the Holiday Inn site doesn't indicate it had one so I didn't expect it. You do hear some noise in the halls at night (it's party town Montreal so not totally unexpected...sure you could call downstairs to get them to calm things down if needed), and in the mornings (people are on vacation and some of them are early birds). Location of this hotel is fantastic as some have noted. One thing to note though is that the access to the hotel and the parking is on St. Urbain and not Viger. Program your GPS for the intersection of St. Urbain and Gauchetiere otherwise you'll have to drive around trying to figure out how to get onto the one way Southbound Rue St Urbain. I wouldn't let some of the negative reviews scare you. Put your expectations in the proper place, do your research on what is there and what isn't and I think you'll like the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS NEED UPDATING NOW!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnBooks
Reviews.Content: As a Gold Priority member I've been in many HI properties in the past few years. The virtual tour posted on the web site I would assume is of a remodeled room. The room I was given (822) was suppose to be NonSmoking, it was posted as such but you can smell the nasty old cigarette smell and there were ash trays in the room. The carpet was stained and old. HI corporate needs to step up and demand better from their affiliates! I will not recommend this hotel to my business partners. If your a college kid , this place may be ok , but not for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Lucmon
Reviews.Content: Booked room for 4 adults and got a room with ONE BED. We booked 2 months in advance thru Hotwire and had also reserved 1 cot so my 22 year old daughter didn't have to sleep with her brother ($19). When we complained at the front desk they told us they were booked solid and that our concern was with Hotwire not the Holday Inn. When I asked to speak to the manager they said they would give us another cot (FREE of charge). We left to tour Montreal and when we got back opened up the cots to find that one of them was so thin the springs would push up thru your back. We ended up sleeping 3 adults in one bed (little or no sleep). The next day we complained to the manager and they decided to give us 2 newer cots that were more comfortable. $126.00+$20.00parking +fees+taxes+no sleep=priceless I had sent an email to Hotwire that evening but didn't get a response until we got back. Hindsight I would of called them right away and they would of moved us to a more respectable hotel. Hotwire blamed Holiday Inn and yhey blamed Hotwire. It's not the way I wanted to end my holidays in Quebec.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT Stay at this Hotel Again”
Reviews.Author: WolfClan42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while attending the Otakuthon Anime convention in downtown Montreal. It was the hotel recommended by the Convention. The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable, but that was the extent of the positive experiences. Don't stay at this hotel if you plan to get any sleep. It is the only hotel or motel that I have ever seen that does not have proper drapes on the windows. There were only very thin, white sheer curtains on the windows, therefore there was NO privacy. You could see everything outside and I'm sure that people could see through into the room too. The lights of the downtown city streamed through the windows all night and lit up the room all night. It was like having the lights on in the room all night! The A/C was extremely noisy too! Parking is in an underground garage that is difficult to access due to weird one-way street access. It also costs extra to park your car. There are NO luggage carts available unless you are willing to pay for more expensive concierge service. We were promised a refrigerator in the room when we made our reservation. The fridge was not there on check-in. On calling the front desk to inquire, we were told that we would have to take a room with only one bed if we wanted a fridge. That was not possible for 4 people. The downtown location is terrible if you don't like noise! We heard sirens, traffic, and noise all night. In the early morning, the noise from outside was terrible, even on the weekend. Starting at 7 am, all we could hear was slamming hotel room doors that sounded like sonic booms each time. Bring along your own coat hangers if you want to hang anything in the closet. There were only five hangers for 4 people. We were told that our room gave us Executive Lounge privileges, where we could get coffee, etc. at any time of day. Turns our our room key cards wouldn't even open the lounge doors as they were supposed to. If I have to pay over $150 per night for a room, I at least want to have drapes on the windows! We want to return to the Convention next year, but will plan to find another hotel, even if it means having to travel to the Convention rather than walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Welshlad15
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor I was seriously thinking of cancelling my booking for this hotel and staying somewhere else... I'm so glad I didnt as the hotel is great! We arrived around 11pm and were checked in straight away by Alex - who was an absolute star; very professional and friendly and a definite asset to the hotel's team of staff. The first thing that struck me about the hotel was the cleanliness, it is spotless. The room we had was huge and you can just sink into the beds as they are so comfy :-) On our first day I spoke to Pierre, the hotel's concierge, who again was a star and a great asset to the hotel, he gave us some first class recommendations on how to explore the city to get the most out of it and pointed us in the direction of ' Eggspectations' on St-Jacques West, which is literally a 5min walk from the hotel and serves a variety of reasonably priced breakfasts which will guarantee to set you up for the day - Pierre, thank-you so much! The location of the hotel cannot be beaten, its right on the edge of Chinatown, within a 5 minute walk to the cobbled streets of old Montreal and a 10-15 min walk to the underground city in the downtown area. We had tickets for a couple of shows at the Bell Centre and again, the arena was literally a 10-15 walk from the hotel. If I had any 'negative' comments to make about our room it would be that the bathroom was very dark (no window and very low lighting) and there was no safe in the room to keep passports, money etc, however there are complimentary safety security boxes available behind the reception desk. Montreal is a very safe and clean city, however there is a homelessness element to be seen in the park accross the road from the hotel, this did not infringe on our enjoyment or safety in any way. The concierge is at the main entrance to the hotel during the day and there is room card access to open the main doors at night, this area was always very well lit. The main hotel reception is on the second floor and all lifts automatically stop here no matter which floor you choose. All-in-all, we would definately stay here again, it is a safe, secure, clean hotel and in a great central location for exploring all that Montreal has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mat_sens_rbk
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the main reason I booked a room there. It was close to everything. 4 minutes walk from St-Catherine and 4 minutes walk the other way to Old-Montreal. The only inconvenience is that it is close to a Fire Station. The lobby is great with the little pond. We arrived early and a room was ready for us. The room are really big and the beds are very comfortable. I had a hard time sleeping on their pillows though. We had a executive room with a King bed and a balcony. The balcony came in handy to watch the fireworks ( every saturday night in the summer?). The all-you can-eat breakfast is not a little continental breakfast with just toast and fruit. They had sausage, eggs, bacon, crepes, etc. Overall the hotel is at a very reasonable price for what you get. I would recommend it to anyone and if you have the extra cash take the executive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Makeover!!”
Reviews.Author: takemeaway100
Reviews.Content: Parts of the hotel are lovely, but for the most part the place in tired. Our beds were brutal, (something like you'd find in a resort in Cuba) and out dated. We could not check in until 4:00 and the floors was still wet. There was a lot of noise at night and we could have done without the "sex" business cards in our door in the mornings.The resturant was over priced and the food gross!! For four of us breakfast was $78.00!! Pay the little extra and stay else where. The place din't feel safe either. Believe it or notI'm not picky so this should tell you how bad it was!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellin_lady
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to its central location while attending the Jazz Festival. The checkin was fast and efficient. We received a lovely room on the 9th floor. The bed was comfy, the bathroom HUGE and the balcony door opened (which I like). The location of this hotel is hard to beat. You are right in Chinatown with dozens of restaurants and shops right next door, steps away from Old town, and very close to Ste. Catherine..the city's fashion centre. I would not hesitate in staying at this hotel for future Montreal visits.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: misschee
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my weekend at this hotel. Was quite upset at at my overall experience. I had called in previously and confirmed via email I would need a crib in my room. Ask specifically if it was a portable crib or a playpen. So as you can see, the sleep arranged for my baby was high on my list. I was told I would get a crib during my stay via email and told via phone I would get one. Called again a night before my stay to ensure I would get a crib, was told just to let them know at check in. Asked if they would run out due to long weekend, and was told no, cribs request aren't a popular request. On the day of check in, asked for a crib again, was told to just give them a call once I'm in my room and they will bring it up. Called downstairs and waited over an hours and still no crib sent up, by then I had left to enjoy the city. Came back later in the evening and still no crib. Called again, was told they will have one up. Got a call 20 mins later saying no more cribs. I was fuming. To make this short. i'm still very upset, didn't get a crib during my first night day so I did not get a good night sleep, my baby was cranky all night cause he's used to sleeping in an enclosure area for security and I was worried he would roll off the bed the whole night. Did not get a crib till the second night. But overall, I was very unhappy with the service and would not come back. Location is great, room cleaniness were average, room size was good, thought there was a fridge when I booked but no fridge in the room not very great for a family with kids. Paid for a good night sleep and did not get it. Horrible customer serivice after many contacts to ensure I would get a crib.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location Near Old Montreal & Palais des congres”
Reviews.Author: jfoote
Reviews.Content: While attending a convention at the Palais des congress, we stayed at the Holiday Inn Select. The Hotel is across the street from the Palais, adjacent to Chinatown and a few blocks from Old Montreal. The executive room was booked using an Entertainment Book card. The room with balcony seemed new and the large lounge on the 9th floor was a bonus. The decor of the lobby is unique with a hugh fish pond traversed by walkways. Although you can order light fare at the bar, the restaurant serves a full complimentary breakfast buffet together with an Asian buffet for other meals. In terms of Holiday Inns, this hotel should be rated near the top and is definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lederfrau
Reviews.Content: I quite enjoyed this Holiday Inn. The bed was very comfortable, the room was nicely appointed. All new carpets in the hallways. The indoor "stream" at reception was an interesting feature. Stayed on the business floor, quiet room. Great view from the balcony. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: lwwylam
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Select is ideally located in Chinatown, within walking distance of Old Montreal and across the street from a metro stop. It's by no means a typical Holiday Inn, decorated according to principles of Feng Shui, with an excellent upscale Chinese restaurant in the lobby serving dinner and dim sum overlooking a large goldfish pond. TVs could definitely stand to be replaced, as they're now ancient technology and fading fast. But this was a charming break from the monotony of corporate chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need some improvement”
Reviews.Author: engineer64
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I am a Priority Club member. I was upgraded to a better room, but was not impressed. The HVAC system is the old style in the wall. The temperature could never be constant. The internet wifi was free, but, was slow at times. There is a PC lounge - but had only a tv, pc, printer and coffee in there. It was HOT in the lounge and the ac did not work there well either. I ate in the bar one night and they one bartender waiting the tables and bar - the service was slow but, was not the employees fault. There was a tv at the bar - but did not work. The food was good - beers expensive $7.50.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jayhawk61
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal (up from the US) with my family for Mother's Day to see Cirque du Soleil. We selected the Holiday Inn Select Montreal Centre Ville for its proximity to Old Montreal. We really liked the place. First of all, the staff were quite friendly and helpful. The location was wonderful. The hotel is within feet of the Place D-Armes metro stop which made it very easy to get to locations like the Biodome and the Botanical Garden. We could see the Basilique Notre-Dame out of our room window and had an easy walk to the Science Center and the Quai Jacques-Cartier where Cirque du Soleil in located. The hotel is on the edge of Chinatown and is within feet of a pedestrian street in Chinatown with lots of restaurants, groceries, shops, and bakeries. There is an ATM machine in the lobby of the hotel and a CIBC ATM within one block. The hotel itself is fun because of the Asian motif, the fish pond in the lobby, and the pool/hot tub/sauna. The fish pond kept my 6 year old happy while her parents got a quick drink in the bar. The buffet breakfasts at the hotel restaurant were quite tasty with a wide array of foods - eggs, bacon and sausages, crepes, pastries, fresh fruit, juices, yogurts, etc. If you are looking for a convenient hotel that is friendly and has some personality, I say give this one a try on your next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BonnieBoston
Reviews.Content: Recently I used Hotwire... asked for a 3 1/2 star hotel in Downtown Montreal...and landed at the Holiday Inn Select Montreal Centre-Ville for $80 a night...so a cheap stay for one night to explore Montreal. I will say it is very centrally located, (please note the hotel is located in Chinatown section of city) you can turn right and walk to St. Catherine Street, if that is your thing or turn left and walk to Old Montreal, which we loved and is even closer. As far as the hotel, you can't beat the price, but you will most likely have to tolerate loud crowds coming home late at night, and I'm not sure if it is the same in everyroom, but the heat/AC did not work very well... and the room had no darking shades only shears. The bed was decently comfortable, but the room decor is less to be desired. I read somewhere they did renovations in 2010...it was obviously not to all rooms. So although I would not stay here again, if you are on a budget and want to be close to Downtown and Old Montreal, it's good enough.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!”
Reviews.Author: Afcan
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire. It was rated 3 1/2 star but I would rate it 2 1/2. The hotel is old, tired, and an outdated building (nothing like shown on its website). Parking is a nightmare, front desk service is very poor, location may be central but the most difficult spot to access and you will frustrated trying to find a street that lets you get to the hotel, $3.50 + tax for a medium bottle water in the room (robbery), bathtub looks a hospital, the lobby is full of stuff (junk). The only thing that I found good was the King sized bed and the free Internet (very slow to connect). So, pay $30 dollar more and go to a 4 star or more hotel. Stay away from this one please and you`ll save yourself money and disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but parking may be a nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: useref15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 6 of my friends. First off, I would NOT recommend this hotel for families with children if you are staying during spring break. I admit, the hotel can get very rowdy with a bunch of teens. When I first arrived, parking was a huge nightmare. They allow public parking in the garage, so it quickly fills up. Since I arrived on a Friday, there were no spots inside the garage. There was a tiny spot that I was trying to fit into, but it just wasn't working, because of a large car. Its not easy to maneuver in the garage as well. Cars are parked all over the place. You shouldn't have a problem if you are arriving during a weekday. After the parking situation, I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. The location was amazing! The Metro stop was literally right across the street. You don't really need it however, because you are centrally located in the middle of everything. The hotel was full of teens such as myself. So it was definitely on the noisy side. The pool and hot tub in the hotel was occupied most of the time we went down there. Hotel was located near all tourist spots such as St. Catherines st and St Laurent for all your fun nightlife. We also caught a Canadiens v.s Bruins game, which was awesome. They have some crazy fans there. The hotel itself was very clean. Thats all we ask for. We don't need any fancy amenities. The bedding was clean and extremely comfortable. In room service was offered everyday, but wasn't needed. When we called up for extra towels, they were quickly brought up. I just want to stress to people who are looking for a quiet hotel, that you may want to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Asian-inspired budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kanada82
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through hotwire for a recent "flatmate" weekend in Montreal. If it wasn't for the Asian-inspired touches (water garden on the reception level, detailing outside), it would be a pretty run-of-the-mill HI express. Room was very spacious, beds quite comfortable, and overall very clean. WiFi was free, but spotty (was able to get it on my laptop, but not on my iPhone. Location was perfect - literally steps to the metro station (which was perfect, as we spent most of our time exploring the shops, boutiques and eateries of Plateau), and a short walk to Old Montreal. We could've walked to the shopping of rue St. Catherine, but were tuckered out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Asian themed hotel in the downtown core”
Reviews.Author: avi8rjosh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night when my trip was unexpectedly extended. I will try to give you as much information as I can but keep in mind I was only there for less than 15 hours. The hotel is located at Viger and St. Urbain streets in the "Quartier Chinois", or China-Town area of Montreal. There is a metro station directly across the street and access to other parts of the downtown area are easily accessed by the metro or by walking. Upon entering the hotel, you will immediately notice the Asian motif everywhere. You enter on the main floor which has a conveninience store and a few asian boutiques. Below is a small Asian mall with more herbal-type stores, chinese collectibles, etc. Reception is on the 2nd floor as is the on-site restaurant called "Chez Chine", obviously the main cuisine is Chinese. It looked quite expensive but it was still somewhat busy. There is also a bar located in the lobby as well. If you want to try good Chinese food just walk down la Gauchetiere and you will find endless restaurants. It is also quite clean compared to Toronto's chinatown, abit smaller. Check-in was fast and we were given room 706. The SPC Priority club is located on the 8th or 9th floor as is the lounge. The room consisted of two queen beds (proper queen size), a TV, a full size long dresser, and work-desk with chair. Wifi is available and its free. The bathroom is a standard 3-piece with sink, bath/shower, and toilet. Everything looked newer and the hotel was obviously renovated recently. I really liked the beds as they were almost "memory-foam" style. We had a room facing St. Urbain which was better than our view of the interior corridor at the HI Express on Rene Levesque. This hotel has a gym equipped with a treadmill, stair climber, cable-exercise machine, free-weights, and some other stuff. It's small but has enough stuff for a decent work out. The pool is located near the gym as well and it was ample sized from what I could see. I did not have a chance to look for a steam/sauna room but I believe there is one. (consult the hotel website). I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere with easy access to the metro, Chinatown, or Place-de-Congres. Parking is $18 per 24hr and it includes unlimited in/out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY positive and enjoyable stay...”
Reviews.Author: habsrool
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent rooms (although not flat-screen TVs) with free unlimited high speed Internet access. Pool and hot tub were also very good. But the willingness of the staff and managerial team to make MY experience as enjoyable as possible is what made this such a great trip. The only thing that would have made it absolutely perfect is free parking, but I guess you can't have everything!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected gem in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: roseswithribbons
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at this hotel and came away so happy and so impressed - it is a really great Holiday Inn and the photos on their website don't do it justice - it's very nice. Location is excellent. Right down the street from Vieux-Montreal, directly across the street from the metro (easy to navigate - fabulous system), in the heart of Chinatown (which is a small Chinatown, only a few blocks long - open til 3:00 AM and lots of great bakeries and restaurants). The rooms are very spacious, mine had a great view of the Hotel de Ville, and the the mattresses feel brand new (I requested a firm mattress and a quiet, non-smoking room and was provided one with such genuine kindness by Tanesha at the front desk), everything is very clean, and they have nice toiletries in the bathrooms, and everything you could possibly need (makeup mirror, hair dryer, etc.). The restaurant (Lotus) had the greatest room service meal ever - fresh salmon and vegetables, presented beautifully and delivered immediately. I did not try the Chinese restaurant in the hotel (looked very beautiful over a bridge in the lobby under which there were koi fish), but it looked very, very nice - the whole lobby is very nice. The front desk staff are unmatchable - bend over backwards to accommodate you. I was treated with such efficiency, deference and kindess (special thanks to the very lovely people at the desk - specifically Tanesha and manager Adriana Martins), that I would go back again just due to their consideration of me. The fantastic concierge (Dan) arranged things in a flash and was so knowledgeable and accommodating and kind. Also, they have a nice little swimming pool and a wonderful hot tub - that has powerful jets and very hot water. There is a room with equipment (weights, etc.) and a sauna and there are always clean towels there for you. I would go back to Montreal and stay at this hotel. You cannot beat the price, the location, the service and the good will - not anywhere! It is refreshing to find a chain hotel that feels like a boutique hotel and to be accommodated in every way as I was. I am a 63 year old business professional who has traveled extensively for business and pleasure and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel if you get a good price”
Reviews.Author: getawayOttawa
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through pricline after bidding 60$ for a 3.5 star in downtown Montreal, unfortunately we got this one. After taxes and one night parking, the actual cost was $104. The negatives: old decor and mildly poor service. It was a hassle to get a wine/bottle opener from the bar. And when we returned after dinner at 11pm on a saturday night, the bar was closed which was a bit odd, no biggie though. The positives: our room was very spacious, could have been because we had a corner room but was pretty impressed. Also, the location was good for shopping on Catherine street or colse to old montreal. All in all, it was an average hotel and if you get a good price then it is probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: jonkannu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights over New Years. Parking was $18/night PROS: -Fantastic staff and great service, clean rooms -Awesome dowtown location: close to Old MontrÃ©al and Notre Dame, in Chinatown -Metro (Place d'Armes) across the street -beautiful lobby with the Chinese pond and walkways -free wireless internet CONS: -hotel could use a bit of sprucing up (carpets), but still good -need signs to direct to the underground parking (have to enter via St. Urbain -ONE WAY) -Reception is on second floor -Little confusing when going to street level and parking Overall, we had a very comfortable and pleasant experience would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Barely acceptable room, absolutely horrible service”
Reviews.Author: J105Bow
Reviews.Content: I spent over 60 nights a year, for 2 years, on an intensive project in Montreal and this was their corporate hotel. As such, I know it very well. Likewise, I've spent over 100 days a year in Montreal, on business and pleasure over the last 4 years and have stayed at a full range of hotels - from the high end St. James to fleabag roach motels on Parc when sudden thunderstorms shut down Trudeau airport. Credentials established, this place pissed me off more than any other. My tribulations with the front desk were frustrating, never having the same experience twice. I called the corporate sales manager multiple times and asked to be put on file so that I could fast-track the check -in process...was assured that things would be taken care of, but it never was. Went as far as having the company's corporate travel person advocate on my behalf, but again, nothing ever done. I could [--] all day, but these were the 2 deal breakers: a) An acquaintance of mine - who happened to be the GM of corporate travel at AMEX at the time - *refused* to come in my room because the disgusting smell of it made him nauseous. b) I broke my ankle slipping on the ice outside in winter. When I went to the front desk, the night *manager* was the only person present. I asked him to call a cab to the hospital because I was a guest at the hotel and "I think I broke my ankle." His response was, "I'm busy. I'll get someone for you." At that point, I got upset, pointed out again that I was a hotel guest, I was injured and needed his attention. Without looking up - or at me - he again stated (more forcefully), "I'm BUSY! Someone will be with you shortly." I should note that at this point it was about 11:00 in the evening and the only people in the lobby were him and I. I ended up hopping on 1 leg to my room, getting my ID, hopping back down to the sidewalk, grabbing my own taxi and going to the hospital - where they confirmed that I had indeed broken my ankle. For multiple reasons, I will NEVER stay here again. For the price point, the HI Express up the street is much better - both in terms of room and customer service. For a few dollars more, you can usually get a room at the Complexe Desjardins Hyatt which is my fave place to stay when a client is paying on their per diem. For the Old City, a couple of bucks extra will get you into the XIX Siecle, which is a wonderful, laidback, attentive little boutique hotel. Avoid the HI Centre Ville unless you want production-line service and a gross room. I should know. I spent the better part of a year there (btw - the food coming out of the kitchen is absolutely inedible and their bar is a master at the "short pour...Don't bother eating or drinking there either!

Reviews.Title: “needs a bit of TLC”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked this on PL for 64$. Situated in the Mtl Chinatown. The lobby is on the second floor, which is a bit strange (chinese stores on first floor). Check in was fast and friendly. The room was actually quite big, thought the furniture is a bit dated...CRT TVs, and that bizarre shirt press (first time I seen this). The pool was grubby, the jacuzzi was out of order, and the gym in dire need of renovation (old 1980s equipment). Had chinese breakfast (steamed buns, congee and dim sum) closeby. Would go back through PL only.

Reviews.Title: “good value & great location”
Reviews.Author: frameworks
Reviews.Content: we stayed in 2 rooms for 2 nights on a weekend in november 2009. the restaurant was very good - excellent buffet for breakfast with everything you can imagine, inlcuding a hot omeltte bar. kids eat free if an adult eats as well. the service was decent, but nothing out of the ordinary. the halls and elevators are a little tired, but the rooms are great, nicely decorated, spacious, huge bathroom. the lobby is unuusal, very pretty, with coi fish swimming around. the pool area was nice, nothing fancy, but useful. on sunday morning it was closed for a while. when it re-opened, we went swimming ... my son cut his foot quite badly on BROKEN GLASS. when i reported this to the front desk, they expressed surprise, said they would send someone to look into it, but didnt offer to compensate us in any way. the spa is a bit outdated, but i had a great massage and it was very affordable - $53 for 45 minutes. the halls were pretty noisy at night. if you are a light sleeper, this might be trouble.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: mogwai-love
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff. Very loud at night, fire station across the street- if you are a light sleeper, it might not be the hotel for you. Also, Holiday Inn should update the interior of the guest rooms and hallways. Breakfast was mediocre, typical hotel buffet. If you are looking for somewhere to leave your bags and sleep, this is the place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Scarlet, frankly they don't give a damn”
Reviews.Author: Otowngal
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel. I noticed how tired the decor was looking, particularly in the halls, rooms are a little better but not much. We stayed in this hotel the weekend of Oct 3/4 2009 and had our car broken into in the garage and several items stolen, (nothing of consequential value unless added together, cell phones, CD collection, etc) Hotel management's response? "Really well that's weird cause we haven't had any other reports". I know for a fact that the items missing from the car were purchased from a shopping mall PRIOR to our arrival at the hotel. We arrived around 5pm, parked the car, LOCKED the car (we checked before walking away, the car honked AND the blue light was still flashing at us the next morning) ... it wasn't until we'd driven away that I began to notice items missing. It wasn't until we'd arrived back home that we noticed the items missing out of our trunk. DESPITE PROMISES THAT THE HEAD OF SECURITY WOULD BE CALLING TODAY WE'VE HEARD NOTHING, NADA, ZERO, ZILCH, ZIP FROM THE HOTEL MANAGEMENT I realize they have no liability for the items stolen but they damned sure have a liability for their guests' safety. Certainly not looking to have my items replaced ... not at all, BUT..... NEVER EVER AGAIN and not cause we got robbed, what the punks got is of little consequence in the grander scheme of things. Nope, we'll never go back simply because the hotel doesn't have the BRAINS to call and say "SORRY ABOUT THAT" and gee maybe we should review our security policy. There is a street level entrance that is unattended and left UNLOCKED all night long (we went in that way after returning from dinner on Saturday night, around 1:00 am). So, yes the street people have complete access to the ENTIRE hotel all night long.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very good. Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: vacationer16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from Sep 18-21. It is ideally located in the heart of Chinatown and just 2-3 blocks from Old Montreal. In front of the hotel you will find a big subway station (Place DÂ´Armes) and sort of a shopping complex. I arrived from Toronto at 7:30am and my room was ready. That was a big plus. Blvd RenÃ© Levesque is just 2 blocks away and Ste. Catherine Street is just 3 blocks, just the center of all the shopping and nightlife in Montreal. My room was very well appointed, contrary to previous reviews of the rooms being run down. It was very clean, comfortable, A/C worked perfectly and lots of hot water in the shower. I was very pleased with the free wi-fi, which was fast enough. However, breakfast is a solid $20 plus tax, something outregaous for a first day meal. I enjoyed walking around and going to Tim Hortons for breakfast in the mall adjacent to the subway station. If you stay in this hotel you will be pleased with everything the city has to offer, just in the footstep of the hotelÂ´s door. Cab to the airport is CAD$40. If you need any more info, feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: schoonovm
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in two rooms for one week. There is not one thing to complain about. The hotel was updated and very nice. We were on the floor with the exercise room and pool. It was a calm, quiet week. The lobby and bar area were relaxing. The rooms were clean and tended. Our bill was settled easily and accurately. The location is excellent.
